adjective.description: (of a period of time) going by.
examples: she detested him more with every passing second

adjective.description: Meeting or surpassing the requirements of a course or examination.

noun.description: The passage of something, especially time.
examples: with the passing of the years she had become a little eccentric

noun.description: The action of throwing, kicking, or hitting a ball or puck to another team member during a sports match.
examples: his play showed good passing and good control
the passing of the Cold War and the rise of a new Europe

phrases: the research was mentioned only in passing
Apparently it was mentioned in passing the other night, and the pentagon is being very close-lipped about it.
A couple of months back, I mentioned this blog in passing to someone I know.
It was mentioned in passing that computers used binary, and programmers would often use octal.
You make mention in passing of nuclear power, but doesn't the logic of your argument mean you should be a strong supporter of it?
